Tutorial: Introduction to Restorative Justice. Restorative justice is a theory of justice emphasizes repairing harm caused by criminal behaviour. It is best accomplished cooperative processes include stakeholders. This lead transformation people, relationships and communities. Practices and programs reflecting restorative purposes respond to crime by: 1  identifying taking steps to repair harm, 2  involving all stakeholders, and. 3  transforming traditional relationship communities their governments responding to crime.

Organize volunteer community panels, boards, committees that meet offender to discuss incident and offender obligation to repair harm to victims community members. Facilitate process of apologies to victims communities. Invite local victim advocates provide ongoing victim-awareness training for probation staff.

The purpose of this paper to point out number unresolved issues in criminal justice system, present underlying principles of restorative justice, then to review growing amount empirical data on victim-offender mediation.

Each of types communitiesâthe geographic community victim, offender, crime; the community care; and civil societyâmay injured by crime in different ways degrees, but all affected common ways as well: The sense safety confidence members is threatened, order within the community threatened, (depending on kind crime) common values of the community challenged and perhaps eroded.

The approach based theory justice that considers crime wrongdoing to an offense an individual community, rather than the State. Restorative justice fosters dialogue between victim and offender shown highest rates victim satisfaction and offender accountability.

Phloem and xylem complex tissues that perform transportation food water plant. They the vascular tissues plant together form vascular bundles. They work together unit to bring about effective transportation of food, nutrients, minerals and water.
Phloem and xylem complex tissues perform transportation food water plant. They are vascular tissues of the plant and together form vascular bundles.
Phloem is conductive (or vascular) tissue found in plants. Phloem carries the products photosynthesis (sucrose glucose) leaves parts the plant.
Unlike xylem (which is composed primarily dead cells), the phloem is composed of still-living cells that transport sap. The sap is water-based solution, rich sugars made by the photosynthetic areas.

In xylem vessels water travels bulk flow rather cell diffusion. In phloem, concentration of organic substance inside phloem cell (e.g., leaf) creates diffusion gradient by water flows cells and phloem sap moves source organic substance sugar sinks turgor pressure.

The mechanism which sugars transported through phloem, sources to sinks, is called pressure flow. At the sources (usually the leaves), sugar molecules are moved the sieve elements (phloem cells) through active transport.
Phloem carries the products photosynthesis (sucrose glucose) from leaves to parts of the plant. â¦ The corresponding system that circulates water and minerals the roots is called xylem.

Xylem transports water and soluble mineral nutrients roots various parts of plant. It responsible replacing water lost through transpiration and photosynthesis. Phloem translocates sugars made photosynthetic areas plants to storage organs like roots, tubers bulbs.

Chinese Immigration Chinese Exclusion Acts. In the 1850s, Chinese workers migrated to United States, first to work in gold mines, also to take agricultural jobs, and factory work, especially in garment industry.

The Rise Industrial America, 1877-1900. When 1873 Mark Twain and Charles Dudley Warner entitled co-authored novel The Gilded Age, gave the late nineteenth century popular name. The term reflected the combination outward wealth and dazzle inner corruption poverty.

American objections to Chinese immigration took many forms, generally stemmed from economic cultural tensions, well ethnic discrimination. Most Chinese laborers came to United States did so order send money back to China support families there.

The rise of industrial America, the dominance wage labor, and the growth cities represented perhaps the greatest changes period. Few Americans at the end Civil War had anticipated the rapid rise of American industry.

The resulting Angell Treaty permitted the United States to restrict, not completely prohibit, Chinese immigration. In 1882, Congress passed Chinese Exclusion Act, which, per terms Angell Treaty, suspended the immigration Chinese laborers (skilled or unskilled) for period 10 years.

But basic details of your urine -- color, smell, and often you go -- give hint whatâs going inside body. Pee your bodyâs liquid waste, mainly made water, salt, and chemicals called urea and uric acid. Your kidneys make when filter toxins other bad stuff from blood.

However, red-colored urine can also occur blood present in the urine can an indicator of disease or damage to some part of urinary system. Another example is yellow-brown greenish-brown urine may be sign of bilirubin the urine (see The Chemical Examination section).

The shade, light or dark, also changes. If it no color all, may be because youâve drinking lot of water taking drug called a diuretic, which helps your body get rid fluid. Very dark honey- brown-colored urine could be sign that youâre dehydrated and need to get more fluids right away.
A good rule of thumb darker urine, the more water need drink. And urine any color besides various shade of yellow (which weâll get into down below) something may wrong.

Some people claim timing the barley harvest in Israel should the deciding factor as to start the new year for determining observance God's annual Feasts and Holy Days.

Barley (Hordeum vulgare L.), a member of grass family, a major cereal grain. It was one of first cultivated grains and is now grown widely. Barley grain staple in Tibetan cuisine and eaten widely peasants Medieval Europe. Barley has also been used as animal fodder, as a source fermentable material for beer certain distilled beverages, and as a component various health foods.

The state of the barley harvest could PERHAPS cause start of year postponed THE FOLLOWING NEW MOON (thereby giving the previous year 13th month), the state the barley harvest could NEVER DETERMINE THAT AN EARLIER NEW MOON SHOULD BE USED TO START THE YEAR!

The grape harvest usually completed Tabernacles, of the olive harvest came the autumn festivals. In ancient Israel the primary harvest season extended April to November. This harvest period might subdivided three seasons three major crops: spring grain harvest, summer grape harvest the autumn olive harvest.

Barley not as cold tolerant as the winter wheats (Triticum aestivum), fall rye (Secale cereale) winter triticale (Ã Triticosecale Wittm. ex A. Camus.), but may sown as a winter crop warmer areas Australia and Great Britain. Barley a short growing season and is also relatively drought tolerant.

Barley always sown in the autumn, after the early rains, and the barley harvest, for any given locality precedes the wheat harvest (Exodus 9:31 f), begins near Jericho in April--or even March--but in the hill country Palestine not concluded the end May beginning June.

Pentecost, near end grain harvest, included grain loaf offerings (verses 16-17). Pentecost also called âthe Feast Harvestâ (Exodus 23:16). Barley and wheat were planted autumn ripened spring.
